name: magisterially
content:
Add to word list

in a way that has or seems to have complete authority: She started walking magisterially among the tables. "Please sit down," he said magisterially.
More examplesFewer examplesTaking advantage of a confused USA defence, he scored his goal magisterially.She met many people who spoke magisterially about art and attended fancy dinners.The Lake Tahoe landscape is magisterially exploited by the cinematographer.He magisterially ignored the advice of his political colleagues and published the report.
